clinical_study.brief_title: Huaier Granules for Prevention of Recurrence and Metastasis of Colorectal Cancer Patients Following Radical Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Real-World Study Investigating Huaier Granules for Prevention of Recurrence and Metastasis of Colorectal Cancer Patients Following Radical Surgery
clinical_study.source: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of Huaier granules for Prevention of Recurrence and Metastasis of colorectal cancer patients following radical surgery

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multisite, open-label, prospective study investigating Huaier Granule for Prevention of Recurrence and Metastasis of colorectal cancer patients following radical surgery，to evaluate the efficacy and safety.

primary_outcome.description: Disease free survival (DFS) was defined as the time from participation to the time of tumor recurrence or death.
OS was defined as the time from participation to death from any cause or last patient last visit.
The proportion of Local recurrence-Free Survival subjects to the total number of subjects.
The proportion of Distant Metastasis-Free Surviva subjects to the total number of subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Quality of Life (QOL)
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of Life (QOL) were measured using supplemental quality of life questions. Item score range（12 items）: 1 (worst symptom) to 5 (no symptom). Change: score at 36 months minus score at baseline.
An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship.

An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly.
Immunity function was measured with Immune cells counts and positive rate.

study_pop.textblock: Colorectal cancer patients after radical surgery
